user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BinSemGetIdByName:
```c
int32 OS_BinSemGetIdByName(osal_id_t *sem_id, const char *sem_name)
{
    int32 return_code;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(sem_id);
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(sem_name);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdFindByName(LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sem_name, sem_id);

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BinSemGetIdByName:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdFindByName(osal_objtype_t idtype, const char *name, osal_id_t *object_id)
{
    int32             return_code;
    OS_object_token_t token;

    /*
     * As this is an internal-only function, calling it with NULL is allowed.
     * This is required by the file/dir/socket API since these DO allow multiple
     * instances of the same name.
     */
    ARGCHECK(name, OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND);
    LENGTHCHECK(name, OS_MAX_API_NAME, OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetByName(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, idtype, name, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        *object_id = token.obj_id;

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef int32_t   int32
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I examined the function and the related definitions provided. No compiler-specific language extensions are used in the visible code. Specifically:

- The code only uses standard C constructs: a normal function definition, pointer parameters, macro invocations, typedef-based integer types, assignment, and return statements.
- The macros shown (OS_CHECK_POINTER -> BUGCHECK(...), ARGCHECK, LENGTHCHECK) are macro invocations; their visible usages do not include any compiler-specific keywords or extension syntax. The provided BUGCHECK/ARGCHECK/LENGTHCHECK usages do not themselves demonstrate an extension (their implementations were not shown, but the call sites use only standard C macro invocation syntax).
- No compiler-specific keywords or constructs are present: there is no inline assembly (asm/__asm__), no compiler attributes (__attribute__, __declspec), no typeof, no statement-expression ({ ... }) used as an expression, no nested functions, no pragmas with compiler-specific extensions, no token pasting or other extension-specific operators beyond standard macros, and no use of nonstandard built-in types or integer suffixes.
- The typedefs (int32, osal_id_t) are aliases for standard integer types (e.g., int32_t, uint32) and are not compiler extensions.

Because none of the above indicate a documented compiler extension in the code provided, there are no fragments to flag for investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
